title: DeepMind breaks 50-year math record using AI; new record falls a week later
description: AlphaTensor discovers better algorithms for matrix math, inspiring another improvement from afar.

title: Framework offers refurbished versions of its repairable laptops
description: The company's unique model could make refurbished devices more intriguing.

title: FCC to ban all new Huawei and ZTE equipment on national security grounds
description: Ban would prevent new products from getting FCC approval; older ones not affected.

title: Lufthansa awkwardly abandons AirTag ban after baffling face plant
description: After a confusing, unilateral ban, Lufthansa allows AirTag trackers once again.

title: Netflix with ads launches Nov. 3, will be missing up to 10% of Netflix catalog
description: $7 plan to have 5 minutes of ads per hour, 720p quality limit, and no downloads.

title: Google is serious about its giant video chat booths, starts real-world testing
description: The giant 3D video chat system is getting trialed at WeWork, Salesforce, and more.

title: A dish of neurons may have taught itself to play Pong (badly)
description: Given control of a paddle and feedback, the neurons figured out what to do.

title: Black hole belches out remnants of gobbled star years after initial meal
description: “This caught us completely by surprise—no one has ever seen anything like this before.”

title: US Army soldiers felt ill while testing Microsoft’s HoloLens-based headset
description: "The devices would have gotten us killed," an Army report claims.

title: How to get Doom running in Windows’ notepad.exe
description: 21-year-old hacker: "It fires those neurons that are like, 'Oh, we can do that.'"

title: OnlyFans lawyers accidentally reveal which Meta execs allegedly took bribes
description: Names of Nick Clegg and Nicola Mendelsohn mistakenly not redacted.

title: Digital license plates approved for all vehicles in California
description: Only one company makes the e-ink plates, subscriptions start at $19.95 per month.

title: 32 years in, Microsoft has decided to rebrand “Microsoft Office”
description: Apps aren't changing, and Office will still be available as a standalone purchase.

title: “Battery Genome Project” creators want shared data, better EVs
description: Understanding how different variables affect battery performance.
